Ilja Preuss wrote:

>Hi Lasse!
>
>  
>
>>There is duplication between the two strings but the refactoring
>>(putting the bits into a String array) removed the duplication at the
>>cost of readability. And, sometimes, readability trumps duplication.
>>    
>>
>
>I would be *very* reluctant to accept that. I can't remember an instance 
>where, when at first sight it seemed like accepting duplication improved 
>readability, I couldn't come up with a more appropriate design that was 
>both readable and duplication-free. Most often, I just missed an 
>important insight.
>  
>
It happens to me sometimes, but I'm reluctant to say that readability 
trumps duplication sometimes because it is far to likely to be used as 
an excuse.  Out in the field, I notice that many people really aren't 
used to finely factored code.  If you are, you can remove duplication 
all over the place and still not feel that you are sacrificing 
readability.  But, if you aren't used to that style of programming, 
duplication-free code looks weird and you're liable to find it less 
readable.  It's a matter of acclimation, really.

I wrote a related blog on finely factored code a while ago here: 
http://beautifulcode.oreillynet.com/2007/07/finegrained_factoring.php

Michael Feathers
www.objectmentor.com
